headline: Wells Fargo CEO Charlie Scharf’s Pay Rises to $40 Million in Watershed Year for Bank
summary: Wells Fargo paid Chief Executive Charlie Scharf $40 million for 2025, a 28% raise from a year earlier.  Scharf earned a base salary of $2.5 million and a cash bonus of $9.4 million, according to a securities filing Thursday.  Over the summer, it was freed from a Federal Reserve punishment that had handcuffed growth at the bank since its fake-accounts scandal erupted around a decade ago.

headline: Copper Prices Top $14,500 a Ton For First Time
summary: Copper prices gained as much as 11% to trade above $14,500 a ton for the first time ever Thursday afternoon. Timna Tanners from Wells Fargo talks about the rally in metals and says copper shortages were expected.

headline: Wells Fargo Cuts Verizon (VZ) Target in Wireless Sector Reassessment
summary: Verizon Communications Inc. (NYSE:VZ) is included among the 12 Best Dow Jones Dividend Stocks to Buy According to Hedge Funds. headline: Wells Fargo Proxy Shift Highlights Broadridge Role And Valuation Opportunity
summary: Wells Fargo Wealth & Investment Management has launched its own proxy voting service, deciding voting matters internally. The firm is expanding its use of Broadridge Financial Solutions' (NYSE:BR) technology to power this new proxy voting approach. This shift highlights changes in how large institutions manage proxy voting and the role of providers such as Broadridge in that process. Broadridge Financial Solutions focuses on investor communications and technology that supports core...

headline: Overland Advantage Finances ~$4B Across 18 Transactions in 2025, Demonstrating Continued Strength in Middle Market Lending
summary: Overland Advantage ("Overland") continues to benefit from Wells Fargo's extensive U.S. middle market sourcing footprint and Centerbridge Partners' top-tier private credit underwriting. Overland has provided highly customized credit solutions to family, founder, employee and sponsor-owned companies, financing 18 transactions in 2025 with an aggregate value of ~$4.0 billion. headline: Wells Fargo Expands Tech Focus With Wildfire Venture And New AI Leadership
summary: Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC) has joined industry partners to launch EMBERPOINT, a new venture using advanced technologies for wildfire prevention. The bank is contributing capital and expertise to address wildfire risk, with EMBERPOINT focused on prevention and early detection solutions. Wells Fargo has also appointed Faraz Shafiq as Head of AI Products and Solutions, expanding its focus on AI across financial services. Wells Fargo enters this phase of activity with its shares at $88.03 and a 1...
